original_title: A Treasure Trove Of Random Vintage Tech Resources
original_content:
Finding, collecting, and restoring vintage tech is the rewarding pastime of many a Hackaday reader. Working with old-school gear can be tough, though, when documentation or supporting resources are hard to find. If youre in need of an old manual or a little scrap of software, you might find the Vintage Technology Digital Archive (VTDA) a useful destination.
The VTDA is a simple website. There is no search function, or fancy graphical way to browse the resources on offer. Instead, its merely a collection of files in a well-ordered directory tree. Click through /pics/DiskSleeves/VTDA/ and youll find a collection of high-resolution scans of various old diskettes and their packaging. /docs/computing/Centronics/ will give you all kinds of useful documentation, from press releases to datasheets for printers long forgotten. You can even find Heathkit schematics and old Windows bootdisk images if you dive into the depths.
While it doesnt have everything, by any means, the VTDA has lots of interesting little bits and pieces that you might not find anywhere else. Its a great counterpart to other archival efforts out on the web, particularly if youre a member of the retrocomputing massive.
Thanks to [Itay] for the tip!
title: - ヴィンテージ技術デジタルアーカイブ(VTDA)の活用法
body: ヴィンテージ技術のデジタルアーカイブ(VTDA)は、古いマニュアルやソフトを集めた役立つサイトです。
titles: - ヴィンテージ技術デジタルアーカイブ(VTDA)の活用法
- レトロコンピューティング愛好者必見の資料集
- 古い技術に関する文献や資料を見つける方法
- VTDAで出会える貴重なヴィンテージファイルの紹介
- 電子工作好きのための古いマニュアルやソフトウェア探し
